intro: Xylobium varicosum, commonly known as the warty beggar-tick, is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Xylobium varicosum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
